Sequence Information.Peptide Name: hBD-28 (human beta-defensin-28; hBD28; UCSS1a; natural AMPs; primates, mammals, animals; 3S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli DSM1103 (MIC 37.5 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae DSM681 (MIC 50 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa DSM1128 (MIC 37.5 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC25923 (MIC 25 ug/ml), and S. pneumoniae DSM11865 (MIC 37.5 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-sensitive:E. coli.Toxicity: less than 10% hemolysis up to 120 ug/ml (little hemo.lytic). Also, ~90% smooth muscle cells survived up to 120 ug/ml (ref, see AP3668). UPdated 7/2021; 6/2023; 7/2023

Literature Information.Title: Engineering disulfide bonds of the novel human beta-defensins hBD-27 and hBD-28: differences in disulfide formation and biological activity among human beta-defensins.
